data: A small plaque of white marble, intact on the left but broken on the other three sides. Possible traces of a wreath or similar incised decoration on the upper edge.
Text has sections marked out by the positioning of the first line of each section to the left, but nonetheless maintains an irregular left margin. Slight gap between the two sections of text.

Letters have pronounced terminal serifs. Alpha with straight bar; epsilon with shorter middle bar; mu with vertical first and last, shorter mid-strokes; xsi in form of Z with crossbar; omega distinctive as small circle joined to horizontal foot by a small vertical connector;
late 2nd century BCE or 1st century BCE
Found in the area of S. Lucia in Siracusa, in spring 1897.
observed but not formally autopsied in Palermo museum
Photo J. Prag (2017), by permission of Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas (Prot. 2155, 1 December 2016)
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
Association pour l’encouragement des études greques, « Bulletin épigraphique », Revue des études grecques, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566
Iscrizioni greche lapidarie del Museo di Palermo
M.T. Manni Piraino, Iscrizioni greche lapidarie del Museo di Palermo, Sikelika 6 (Palermo: S. F. Flaccovio, 1973)
Paolo Orsi, «Frammenti epigrafici sicelioti», Rivista di storia antica 5 (1900): 39–66
Giacomo Manganaro, «Nuove ricerche di epigrafia siceliota», Siculorum Gymnasium 16 (1963): 51–64
Luigi Moretti, «I technitai di Siracusa», Rivista di Filologia e di Istruzione Classica 91, fasc. 1 (1963): 38–45
Quattro iscrizioni greche del museo di Palermo
M.T. Manni Piraino, «Quattro iscrizioni greche del museo di Palermo», Kokalos 12 (1966): 200–206
Per la storia dei culti nella Sicilia greca
Giacomo Manganaro, «Per la storia dei culti nella Sicilia greca», Cronache di archeologia e di storia dell’arte 16 (1977): 148–64
